data.title: Wesley John Harlan
data.text:
Marriages

joann - December 24, 1978

Obituaries

Grand Junction Daily Sentinel page 4A Death Notice - October 21, 2017

Wesley John Harlan, 94, Clifton, died Oct. 18, 2017, in Clifton.

Services will take place at 4 p.m. Oct. 28 at the Grand Junction

Seventh-day Adventist Church.

He was the owner of Wes Harlan Trucking.

Survivors include his wife, Joann; four sons, Wesley John Jr. of

Vernal, Utah, Kenneth Gale of Pine Bluff, Wyoming, Curtis Jay

of Greenville, Texas, and Dana Lester of Portland, Oregon; five

daughters, Susan Carol Carlos of De Beque, Cathy Dawn Harlan of

Grand Junction, Theresa Ann Belleau of Thornton, Soli Ferguson

of Clifton, and Candy Lester of San Jose, California; one brother,

Gary Harlan of Monticello, Utah; one sister, Charleyne Dunn of

Grand Junction; 20 grandchildren; and 31 great-grandchildren.

Grand Junction Daily Sentinel page 6A Obituary - October 25, 2017

Wesley John Harlan was

born to Charley Jay and Letha

(Barnhart) Harlan on August

16, 1923, in New Mexico. He

spent his youth in New

Mexico, until the family

moved to Colorado. He

graduated from Grand

Junction High School, and

went on to attend Mesa Junior

College.

Wes joined the U.S. Army

Air Corps, where he was a

Sergeant, and spent four years

in various countries during

WWII including China,

Burma, India, and Indochina.

He married JoAnn Harlan on

December 24, 1978 in

Escondido, CA.

Wes was a member of the

Seventh-day Adventist

Church. He enjoyed camping,

sports (especially golf),

football, hiking, and fishing. He had also lived in Moab, UT,

and Rulison, CO.

Mr. Harlan died on October 18, 2017, as a result of a bus

accident. He was 94 years old.

Wes is preceded in death by his siblings, Gale, and Lafaye, and

his first wife, Bertha, who passed away January, 1977 .

He is survived by his wife of 39 years, JoAnn Harlan; sons,

Wesley John Harlan, Jr. of UT; Kenneth Harlan of WY, and

Curtis Harlan of TX; daughters, Susan Harlan Carlos, Cathy

Harlan, and Theresa Harlan Belleau, all of CO; step-son, Dana

Lester of OR; step-daughters, Soli Ferguson of CA, and Candy

Lester, of CO; brother, Gary of UT; sister, Charleyne Harlan

Dunn of CO; 20 grandchildren, and 31 great-grandchildren.

Services will take place on Saturday, October 28, 4:00 p.m., at

Grand Junction Seventh-day Adventist Church, 730 Mesa Ave.,

Grand Junction, with Pastors Fox and Goley officiating.

Any memorial contributions are appreciated to the Grand

Junction Seventh-day Adventist School.
